intro: Pedilonum lapeyrouseoides, commonly known as the Lapeyrouse's spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to lanceolate in shape. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
